item.title: Corner of Charteris Road and glengall road, 15th September

item.title: Access for Guide Dog user, 15th September
item.description:
There has been barriers erected making it impossible to get up close to the pelican crossing request button. I was there today with my friend who works in the area and is a guide user but she would have been unable cross the road unaided as she couldn’t use the sensor button located under the unit. There has been an allowance made on the opposite side of the road so it is possible there. The same should be done on this side

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Margaret Street, Millbank, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The telecomms cabinet fronting 227, Upper Elmers End (adjacent to the railway bridge; on the opposite side of the road from Abbots Way junction) has its door open and swinging in the High winds., 15th September
item.description:
The telecomms cabinet fronting 227, Upper Elmers End (adjacent to the railway bridge; on the opposite side of the road from Abbots Way junction) has its door open and swinging in the High winds. It is both an electrical access hazard and physical pedestrian hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Elmers End Road, Upper Elmers End, London
